Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service EVER.”
Reviews.Author: revamelissa
Reviews.Content: This is a review based on customer service alone, as we never made it to the hotel. NEVER give them your credit card!! We had a reservation that we were unable to make due to an emergency. We called the night of, which we knew was leaving it late, and were happy to talk to a helpful associate who promised us that our credit card would not be charged and at this point we were quite impressed and planned to stay there once we finally made it to Paris. Three days later the DO charge my credit card for the full stay, even though we never stepped foot in the hotel and more importantly, had been promised they wouldn't. After emailing Julien at the hotel, he admitted to us that they had mistaken us with someone else who did not call to cancel, and has since refused to refund out money and has ignored an emails about this. Awful. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD!! They can decide to charge whatever they want and there will be nothing you can do about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, romantic, and good location”
Reviews.Author: jaynevandorsten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at this hotel, it would have helped if the staff spoke better English. But other than that everything was perfect, the beds were comfortable (hard to find in Europe) and the room had a great ambience making it feel modern yet romantic. Great place to stay because it is quite central and in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Sherlock_12
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Gabriel whilst looking on Trivago I had not heard of it before but thought it looked nice and seemed to have good reviews. I was very pleasantly surprised that the hotel lived up to the great reviews it was very clean, the staff were all very friendly and helpful and my room was very comfortable and airy. I agree that the shower floods the bathroom as the shower door only covers half but it didn't bother me and would be more of a concern fior the hotel as it would after time damage the flooring. My only other comment was that my mini bar was empty so i didn't have the option of having drinks in my room they missed out on sales there as I ran out of water and would have paid the €7 for a bottle. The breakfast was included in my booking so I was happy with it but I wouldn't have wanted to pay the asking price as it was very basic but did the job. Overall this was a really nice hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a good location. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are really well-designed: though small, they are stylish and comfortable. The breakfast is also excellent. We walked everywhere from here: it's about 10 minutes to the Pompidou Centre and the heart of the Marais, and it's only about 20 minutes to the Gare du Nord. We would certainly come back in future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ... tiny!”
Reviews.Author: archetipo69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cute but tiny, the breakfast room is small and cold air come through the door and you can feel the breeze while having breakfast. The rooms are nice, small but efficient, the lighting is great. Breakfast, even though small selection, is good, the products are excellent. Croissants and bread is just perfect. Location is handy but not the heart of the Marais... Overall cute but...

Reviews.Title: “A charming stay”
Reviews.Author: Mila_Gueorguieva
Reviews.Content: You couldn't tell by the look outside that this simple grey parisian facade keeps a hidden jewel. If you are expecting the tipical small french hotel you know so well, you will be strongly surprised. Even the single rooms are so smartly crafted you will have plenty of space to enjoy. The clever lightening hidden in the walls, the tv disguised behind a double mirror and the sleek integrated wardrobes give a real esthetic pleasure as well as the soft, well combined colours. The bathrooms are also spacious and spotless. All the furniture is quite new, in a impeccable condition and very clean. The breakfast is a quite pleasent marriage between the tipical continental (with a good choice of croissants and buns) and a english one (musley, boiled eggs and cheese), the additional fruits and espresso are a great asset. It worth of mentioning the high quality products supplied: olive oil based soaps, showergels etc... The only slightly enervating thing is the internet connection - it's free for all the hotel, although it's delivered at 2 hours sessions, so you will have to reconnect if you will be using it for more than 2 hours. Bottom line: a suprisingly pleasant new type of hotel, a charming experiance I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, beautifully engineered single rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tervuren-Paddy
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, the rooms are fabulously decorated.. or should I say engineered, the single rooms are like a tardis... they somehow manage to fit everything in.. very tastefully too. Breakfast was excellent except for the boiled eggs.. which were barely boiled, perhaps that's how they like it in Paris. Good value for Paris and an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and totally loved it. Very clean, modern, comfortable, quiet, great staff, great location for walking everywhere. Will definitely stay here next time we come to Paris. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gabriel Paris Marais in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bestbusinessbrands
Reviews.Content: Some Parisian hotels aim to sweep guests up in the bustling romance of this great city. The Gabriel, by contrast, is for guests who can get quite enough bustling romance outside the hotel's doors. It's more like a pocket-sized spa resort than a city boutique, and the fact that it's located at the edge of the Marais, which makes for a fair bit of street life, whether by day or by night. A quiet room and a soothingly Zen sense of interior design both go a long way towards producing the desired restful reaction. There's more, if you want it, from organic food (and organic bath products) to detox-themed spa treatments. But most of us will find the mix of high style and luxe comfort to produce all the relaxation we could ask for. As is customary in Paris, the Gabriel can afford to opt out of certain services which the city at large is only too happy to provide - which is the long way of saying there's no restaurant because there's no need for one. This hotel offers a stylish respite from the life of the city, not a full-immersion twenty-four-hour experience. The contrast is the whole point - take part in the bustle by day, and unplug and detox by night.About Hotel Gabriel: Hotel Gabriel is a luxury boutique hotel in Paris from Axel Schoenert. It is located at the edge of the Marais. The hotel features a calming, zen atmosphere with detox spa treatments and organic products. The modern, calming decor led to Hotel Gabriel being known as the first "detox hotel." http://yesshop.yolasite.com/blog/hotel-gabriel-paris-marais-in-paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully trendy and clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: MyriahL
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I booked the Hotel Gabriel based mainly on its aesthetics (and the price considering it was Paris on New Year's Eve) and it did not disappoint in this regard. The hotel and rooms were very hip, impeccably clean and very comfortable, if small (although, no smaller than any other place I've stayed in Paris). Definitely tops were the bath products - wonderful! The location is not as "in" the Marais as I had envisioned but two metro lines are within 5 minutes walk and it was not more than a 20 minute walk to the Pompidou Centre and barely more to the Louvre via the Marais districts. There were a few downsides of which others have mentioned - I agree that style trumped practicality for the bathroom, as it flooded after each shower (granted of course I enjoy rather long luxurious showering). The wifi as well was sketchy but FREE so I let that slide a bit. I did not pay the 17 euros for breakfast - with Paris full of cute/delicious cafÃ© I did not think it worth it. The staff were almost perfect, except for one staff member who continually gave sketchy directions and information regarding shop opening hours. The rest though were extremely helpful and more than accommodating (I am not sure who one of the main staff gentlemen was but he seemed to have a German accent in English and gave me excellent service!)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahcward
Reviews.Content: Having read all the previous reviews and looking at the pictures they did not do this hotel justice! the hotel was absolutely beautiful inside with a really cool concept throughout, rooms were ideal size not overly large but plenty room for 2 people, and that was just a standard double room. Bathroom and shower especially were brilliant and nice and big., also stocked with neccesary products, mini bar was also not overly expensive as some can be. Cleaned and re stocked everyday while we were there, hotel staff also extrememely helpful and spoke excellant English. Did not eat in the hotel as there are loads of places near by if you go exploring and although a little far out from the main attractions eiffel tower, louvre etc however its pretty close to notre damn and that sort of area, its ideally situated next to a main metro station, Republique, was so easy and cheap to use. Only problem for us was the transfer from and to the airport and hotel, it appears to be rush hour every hour in Paris so the transfer time from Charles De Gaulle is around 50mins to an hour which was a bit long for us, however I am led to believe there is a quicker metro link, didn't fancy taking a suitcase on the metro however... Would definately stay again and recommend to anyone looking for an affordable buut chic Parissene Hotel. Also we stayed in Winter (December) and I am led to believe less tourists around at this time of year and the outdoor ice rink and christmas market near the Eiffel Tower and the decorations on the mains streets and cathedrals such as Notre Damn added a nice touch to the trip. Would also recommend this time of year for a Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, stylish and easy reach of public transport”
Reviews.Author: 82Cam
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel - the type I'm a complete sucker for! It looked gorgeous! The room was always very clean and we found the staff to be really helpful too, which surprised me, having in mind the stereotypes about the French attitude to the English! In the bathroom I think style may have won over practicality, as there was a lovely rain shower head, but with no door on the shower this meant the whole bathroom was flooded even from a quick wash. And they weren't generous enough with the towels so I was wringing them out and hoping they'd dry by the time we needed them again! I'd also suggest adding in tea making facilities - this is a pet hate of mine - and tea from the bar cost 5Euros. Top tip - turn left out the hotel and across the road is Cafe Jean, which does take away tea for approx 2Euros and has lots of tasty breakfast items and only a minute's walk away. They could also do with maybe an English language TV station, since they've gone to a lot of effort to incorporate a TV into the room it'd be good to be able to get some use from it for non-Francophones. We didn't have the breakfast because at 17E each we thought this was just too expensive. It's backfired on them somewhat - more reasonable prices on drinks and breakfast and we'd have had them everyday for convenience. But two breakfasts and a few cups of tea and you've spent an extra 50Euros!

Reviews.Title: “hot....but worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: prappd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days in a Double Glowing room. The design of the room and the light and sound effects are amazing. The first thing that irritated me, however, was that the room description states 20-25 m, but when entering the room, my impression was it was just about 10 square meters. The other 10 belong to the bathroom. During my stay there were a few issues with the service: the bathtub was leaking and not repaired, the bin in the bathroom was broken and not repaired, the minibar was not refilled, and most importantly the cleaning personell tried to enter our room w/o knocking at the door first and even more worring, we had pressed the button from inside "do not disturb", which I would have thought makes it improssilbe to enter. The manager explained that there is new personel just in training and that he hopes to improve the service soon. This is what I hope for you too...

Reviews.Title: “Not that convenient, but OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in August 2011 as I could not book my preferred hotel for all of the days of my stay in Paris. The hotel is quite small, located on a side street just off the Republique Metro station. It was not far from a couple of different metro stations but not that convenient otherwise. Not many restaurants close by although the bistro down the street was quite good, there were not many other choices nearby. The room was a decent size for Paris but not large, but the bathroom was actually very generous in size with a large bathtub that also had a showerhead attached to it. Difficult to shower though without getting the floor wet as there were many curtains around the tub which you had to carefully tie together to prevent water from spraying outside. I had the sleep system in the room and tried it a couple of times. The music was nice and the mood lighting was kind of interesting, but I am not sure it did anything to help me sleep faster or better. Front desk was OK with English and OK helpful but not out of their way helpful. All in all an OK hotel, not the best location for sightseeing or shopping, and some neat features but not sure the features are worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbn1975
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with interesting decor. The internet did not work the 4 days we stayed there which lowers the service a little.

Reviews.Title: “Shh..dont tell anyone about it”
Reviews.Author: Zamborgini
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for four nights mid September and I wish this little gem of a hotel could remain a well kept secret. But the cat's out of the bag. Well located close to Place de La Republic with two Metro stops closeby - Oberkampf is the closest. Rooms are small but modern, spotless and well designed. Lighting is a standout feature. High ceilings make it feel larger. Excellent bathrooms with good showers and proper towels. Service was great. From here we could walk to anywhere in the 3rd, 10th and the 11th. The St. Martin Canal nearby is a nice spot. There is a good boulangerie and wine bar within a block and lots of cafes nearby. What else do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an up coming area”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel28120527
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights in October and we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. It is small and has an intimate feel. The rooms are tiny but very clean and a big bathroom. Rooms are tiny in Paris so you have to expect that and you are not in them for ling anyway. The concierge was very helpful and friendly. The area is slightly out of the marais but we really liked this it is a 10 minute walk there and our area was not so touristy. We has dinner at bistro down the road ' the pharmacie' which wAs great and drinks at chez prune recommended by the concierge which we also loved. It's quite grungy and you feel like your in the 'real' Paris . I would recommended this hotel for friends family and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: djjbtoronto
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel in Paris (Oct 2011) for several days. The front staff were extremely pleasant and the rooms were very clean. The hotel was located very close to the Metro. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. It was very good value for Paris. The restaurant 50m away (La Pharmacie) is EXCELLENT and I would recommend that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gabriel”
Reviews.Author: Bewitched625
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The room seemed smaller than the photos but it had everything we needed. The location was great. It was only two blocks from a major metro stop. While the neighborhood was very active, the windows shut out any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved my home for 6 nights”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMimiLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I loved the Gabriel Marais. It became my home for 6 days. Service: Great. For people who thought they may be rude- remember there are cultural differences. Everyone was very nice to me. People spoke English and listened to my bad French. All few words I knew Room: Awesome. I loved my room. No smaller than I expected. I'm in Paris- why do I want to spend all day in my room anyways? Noise: OK, so yes there is some noise but for me it came from my neighbors who didnt want to close their doors quietly. Also they's let the lift door slam. It wasn't housekeeping. If I heard housekeeping, it was after 9a or so. And I was in a basic room and staff was never the reason I was awakened. Which brings me to my upstairs neighbor......who, with heels on every night would walk the runway in her room. Or at least, that what it sounded like. None of this was hotels fault and I am sure if I called, they would have called my neighbor. Food: Did not opt for the buffet since there are French Cafes to be had. Many people did though. There are some treats in the room and though, not cheap, I went for some since I was hungry one night. I was later pleased it was at least a healthy bar. Housekeeping: Everyone nice. Pleasant. Room and hotel are clean. Location: Awesome for me. Not right in touristy area and I loved that for learning the culture better. I felt safe walking at night and there were plenty of places to go for food nearby. You are near Marais, Bastille and Oberkampf depending on which way you walk. Love you Hotel Gabriel and look for me this Winter maybe and for sure this Spring! XO

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDtraveler25
Reviews.Content: The location is great but be warned the room we had is very small. Not sure about all of the rooms but it appeared that all were the same based on footprint of the property. If you like small, boutique hotels then Hotel Gabriel a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: EmsterJ
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has everything you could ask for: good value for money, clean, very friendly service and great location close to all the excitement in Marais and the nightlife in the 11eme.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: I shall try to keep this review short and sweat as i could go on all day about the Hotel Gabriel. My wife and I stayed here last week on our honeymoon and to be honest we both found it a big disappointment. We read a lot of reviews all saying how great this hotel was so decided to make a reservation. I emailed the hotel before our arrival saying that we were on our honeymoon and asking if they could do anything special for us. This is the reply i got - "Thank you for your email and your interest in Hotel Gabriel Paris. We will of course do our very utmost to meet your requests. We will try and provide an upgrade. This I can not guarantee but we will certainly add some perks for you if we can not give you an upgrade". Sounds great right?... The room we got was very standard and not an upgrade, or at least i hope not! Unfortunately we got none of the above things mentioned in the email and i had to actually ask the desk staff if they were going to do anything for us. Can't say i liked having to do that. It fealt cheeky, but if you don't ask you don't get in my opinion. In the end we did get a small bottle of cheap champagne. Ok, i can live with that as it's better than nothing, and the hotel were under no obligation to do anything for us ...and they didn't. The room we had was very small but it was nicely decorated and trendy looking. But hang on a minute ..where is the tea and coffee making facility? There wasn't anything at all except overpriced health snacks. I have never ever stayed at a hotel of this price level and not received these basic facilities. But ok, it's a health and wellbeing type hotel ... Now this is no exageration - i really have thought about this and what i came up with is that i have never stayed in a noisier hotel, and i have stayed in some noisy hotels. One of the reasons we booked at all is that the Hotel Gabriel was sold as relaxation hotel. Rooms were supposed to be quiet and peaceful. They are not ..well not the one we had anyway (202). We could hear a lot of noise from other guests - slamming doors and generally stomping about. The worst thing was that we were right next to the cleaner's closet. I had to go out on the first morning and ask the cleaner to oil the sqeaky door which had been going since 6.30am! Incredibly annoying. We never did get a peaceful nights sleep. Other people have mentioned the shower splashing onto the floor. Ours did that too, leaving soaking wet towels. On the plus side, the staff were friendly, as were the cleaners. There were some nice soaps and gels in the shower room. The whole place looked lovely and was in a nice quietish area just outside the Marais and near to the Oberkampf Metro station. If you don't fancy paying 17 euros for breakfast at the Gabriel there are loads of quality nearby places selling decent French breakfast. So there you go. Some might ask 'why did you not complain to staff at the time?' - well because i was on honeymoon and bacause i'm not really into that. But on here at least my review can give an account of our stay and others can make what they will of it. There seems to be a balance of good and bad. Maybe it depends on what room you have. Ours was pretty terrible to be honest and i wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Clean and Modern but Otherwise Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WillinDC
Reviews.Content: Most of the reports on TripAdvisor are accurate. The hotel is clean and modern. I found the service at the hotel limited but pleasant for the most part. My complaints are as follows -- 1. It is really not in the Marais. As a matter of fact, one of the people working the desk the weekend when I first got there could not even tell me how to get to the Marais. The neighborhood is quaint but not near anything of particular note. 2. I don't know why they call themselves a "detox hotel." Other than some health bars on the refrigerator and some fitness books, there's nothing health or spa like about this place. It's more of a clean, modern bed and breakfast. 3. The noise level is relatively high with thin walls and doors and particularly with the maids, who are pleasant but loud. I was awakened fairly early every morning. They say it's soundproof because of the windows -- ironically, the surrounding area is pretty quiet so that's one place they probably don't need soundproofing. 4. The rooms are somewhat irregular which is okay, but at one point I got a room without a shower. The rooms and elevator are tiny, but I guess that is to be expected in Paris. 5. You really can't even pay to get a standard, nice hotel room at the Gabriel -- the choices are very, very limited. I wound up checking out early and going to a different hotel. The Gabriel has some nice points but it was frankly ruining my trip to Paris with its eccentricity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but horrible service !”
Reviews.Author: AmaurySpe
Reviews.Content: Very nice room and grooming products (Korres) but what an horrible service ! First we were told that breakfast was included in our room rate (3 rooms) but at the checkout it was only included for one of the room and we had to pay 17e per breakfast. Then the airco was faulty in my room so they left a note to offer me to change my room but the reception guy didnt know anything about the room types and didnt offer help to move my stuff or an upgrade. The reception guy refused to get a gin tonic for my colleague even though the bar was open (because the bar tender wasnt there that night,). Then at checkout, their card reader was faulty and connection dropped with all my cards but i was treated like someone with no money and had to run to the corner to get cash to pay the bill (with the same cards!) . The only positive thing is the design and the one of the night receptionist who recommand a brilliant restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pineappleposter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gabriel with my husband slightly unexpectedly - we had an incident in the hotel we'd originally booked in that involved waking up with bugs all over the hotel room. I am so pleased we found this gem and would recommend it over the 2 x more expensive hotel we were previously in. It was very clean, the rooms were nicely laid out, a good size and bathrooms were very nice. I'd consider this hotel extremely good value for money and can't wait to return. It's slightly out of the Marais area but only a short 5 minute walk away (which we enjoyed). We'd also recommend the Pharmacie restaurant at the end of the road - lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, simple, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendy5o4
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and Hotel Gabriel Paris Marais is impressive, but not perfect. PROS: Creative modern design guestrooms and breakfast area, large bathroom, nice bathroom toiletries, closet with plenty of hangers and an in-room safe, cool radio that acts as sleep and relaxation therapy, friendly staff, quiet neighborhood located close to plenty of restaurants. CONS: Guestrooms are a little small with minimal space to lay large suitcases (at most would be 2 plus a storage space right below one of the beds), no suites available, some wear and tear in the bathrooms walls, wood floors are not very clean which could be seen when wearing white socks around the bathroom floors, bathtub is too small and the curtain arrangement is too complicated (a simple 1 piece curtain would have been better), elevator a little small but that's expected in European countries, breakfast is very simple so if you're looking for hot items, you'll need to go out to eat. OVERALL: Would recommend due to cleanliness, reasonable price (by Paris standards), friendly (mostly English speaking) staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - probably best value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LondonCrunchman
Reviews.Content: Although the room was tiny, the space utilisation was great, and I absolutely loved the modern fixtures, the bed, the rain shower and the cleanliness. Its great that they realise that carpets are gross, and wooden floors are the way to go. Anyway, I slept like a log, and really enjoyed the area around the hotel (Oberkampf and Haute Marais). Between Republique and Oberkampf the connectivity is excellent, and there is a large Velib station on the same street which was very convenient. Only slight annoyance was the shower that didn't have a full enclosure and as such, created a very wet floor after every shower, but that a fairly minor complaint. I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is not in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: 05NW
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal as we were able to get 2 single rooms for my daughter and I. They were extremely compact but very nicely designed. The hotel was clean and quiet. The front desk staff was helpful. But--it is not in the Marais!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: soloisaida
Reviews.Content: I love this neighborhood, and this hotel was a great choice . Hard to find a place to chill, and rest from all your walking around this great city. Overall , this hotel is great for an independent traveler, someone who understands the neighborhood, and does not want to be in the middle of the whole tourist scene. Location- *Five minutes away from a metro station (same line as Gare du Nord, so if you are using the Eurostar, this saves you a taxi ride) *Five minute walk from the main artery of the neighborhood. *Amazing restaurants & bakeries right on the corner. Best bread you will ever have is in that corner bakery, trust me. Overall- *Design oriented. Minimalist & cool. Don't expect a cutesy "cosy" place. A lot of white & natural wood, and hidden lighting fixtures. *Definitely a hip vibe. Not a "family" hotel. There are no tacky activity brochures, or tour pamphlets in site. Room- *We had a glow room. We loved it. Ultra modern,very comfortable. *Great amenities, Tub/Shower combo a little hard to maneuver, because of the open room plan. *Great bed. *Small closet *Ipod dock *Need to ask front desk for hair dryer & iron/board Staff- *SUPER friendly & nice

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: lehuakea
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Super comfortable beds, wonderful staff, and delicious petit dejeuner with some protein available (eggs.) Rooms are a bit small, but once you unpack and burrow in, it all works. The staff is friendly and helpful--no attitude. Lots of cool little restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood. And do check out the Canal St Martin, especially if you have kids, as moving boats through the locks is very trippy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little boutique property- clean, trendy, friendly, and fun!”
Reviews.Author: BrookMeakins
Reviews.Content: I only had a quick, 36 hour stay at the Hotel Gabriel in the Marais (or on the border anyway), and I loved my time while there. One receptionist/concierge was particularly helpful (the one that was there during my check in and most of my first day). But even the other desk staff were great- they helped make dinner reservations, rainy day plans, helped find traditional brasseries, cafes, boulangeries, etc., and even helped me rent a bike. The room was tiny- very, very small, but it was perfectly clean, had a darling balcony overlooking the quaint street, and the bathroom was stylish, functional, and inviting. I tend to stay a little closer to the tourist attractions when in Paris, and this was a fun alternative- I'll certainly consider staying here again if the price is right. There was a delightful little local market that opened about 100 feet from the hotel - could have spent all day right there! And the Pharmacia- the little restaurant right down the block- was one of my best meals while in Europe. Friendly and delicious. As always, feel free to message with questions!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, wonderful, great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: fun_city_gal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris, and we loved the Hotel Gabriel. The rooms are very modern, all white, clean and tidy, with a mood light that slowly darkens your room at night (if you turn it on). You can also have the sound of waves or other sounds lull you to sleep. The bed was extremely comfortable. We loved best our 5th floor balcony overlooking Paris rooftops, trees and our little neighborhood. It had a table and chairs and a chaise lounge and we spent a lot of time on it. The room was spare and there was no counter space in the bathroom, but we did have a tub, which I loved, with an overhead shower. Who cares?? We were in Paris! I have bad DUST ALLERGIES and this place was very clean...no problem at all. The floors were not carpeted which is very helpful for keeping my allergies in check while traveling. There is an excellent French restaurant right down the street, La Pharmacie. The hotel is just a few blocks from the busy Place de Republique, where there is a great Italian restaurant called Pizza and Pino. Very good food, and reasonable prices. If you head out of the hotel in the opposite direction of the Place de Republique, the neighborhood is not as great, but don't let this stop you. The hotel is in the Marais, and not far from the Place de Vosges and its great shopping and restaurant options. The staff was very helpful. We had to change rooms b/c of a problem with our door lock, but they were very accommodating and apologetic. They gave us one night at half price b/c we had to change rooms. Luckily, we got one right down the hall. Breakfast was a good light typical European buffet style. Excellent coffee. We give the Hotel Gabriel high marks.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: coljanford
Reviews.Content: This trendy boutique hotel is one of the reasons my wife and I could not resist returning to Paris after our first ever visit in 2010. It is so cool and conveniently located just off the Place de la Republic, surrounded by bars and restaurants. The hotel is a must whenever we are in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Conceirge, Clean Small Rooms, Nice Beds”
Reviews.Author: NeutraGris
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel tucked in a quiet small street. Julien at the front desk was very warm and incredibly helpful throughout our stay at the hotel (as our french was very limited). Pros: Design - Nice lighting layout and lighting design. Decor and overall design was trendy but not aggregious. Rooms - Clean rooms. We had a standard room which was very small (between Japan small and New York small). But it was designed efficiently so it was not a problem. Bathrooms - Bright and clean, Korres toiletries Staff - Very warm and friendly Beds: Nice comfortable beds, clean white sheets, always had restful nights. Location - Although not in Marais, it was a 5 walk to the Republique Station with many transfer stations to different lines throughout Paris. Wifi - Free wifi in rooms and power adaptors available on lend from the front desk. Cons: - Bathroom - Shower floor was very wet after we used it as it did not a full enclosure. Didn't provide us with many towels, we had to use our bath towels to dry the floors daily. - Elevator - Tiny slow elevator, but not a big problem. Note: - We took a the hotel business card (with the hotel address) and had it on us throughout the trip. The hotel is on a very small street (2 streets long) and the cab drivers often needed to use their navigation even when they were very familiar with the area. Made it much easier for cab rides back. - Boutique which meant not a lot of amenities provided by larger hotels (i.e. swimming pool, gym) but we didn't need it!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it was sooo cool!! The room exceeded all of my expectations, I loved how it was such a great use of space and was something different to the stock standard boring hotel room! The bed was divine, I really had to drag myself out of bed to go shopping!! I especially loved the complimentary Korres products which is one of my favourite brands. The location is very handy for the Gare D'Est train station, with lots of cafes and the Metro nearby. The service was great, very friendly and helpful. I stayed in terrible hotel the last time I was in Paris and this hotel has restored my faith in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be surely back”
Reviews.Author: gerlOu012
Reviews.Content: Incredible Hotel, excellent service. My room was beautiful. The location is excellent in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, different, modern boutique, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamHolidayer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in May. Upon arrival we were offered a free upgrade, from the incredibly friendly and helpful member of staff on the front desk. Our room was at the front of the building and whilst the room itself is quite compact we also had a large room with a bath which was separate from the toilet and sink and also a balcony with a sun lounger. The room is incredibly attractive, stylish and modern my favorite feature was a relaxation sleep thing, and whilst I am normally skeptical about these things I slept incredibly well which I believe was as a result of this. The bed is very comfy and large and the aircon works very well. Room was very clean in general and lots of nice touches such as large mirrors and a real hairdryer, couldn't find a kettle though. The location is brilliant, Republique has many cafes, bars etc. and the hotel is less than a 5 minute walk from Oberkampf and Republique subway stations. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel is that when we tried to check out there was only one member of staff on (normally there are at least 3 and I would have thought midday-check out time) would have been one of the busiest times. We waited for approximately 10 minutes whilst this member of staff ordered taxi's and encouraged other guests to write in the guest book etc. for other people and when we could not wait any longer (due to needing to catch a train) we handed the key over and said thank you and were completely ignored. Although this was irritating it does not detract from the fact that this is a gorgeous boutique hotel in a lovely area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy modern artistic - unique "pod-bathroom", bed and furniture.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Room: Uber-modern design, with custom unique furniture, plastic-pod bathrooms, bed, dresser. Room was slightly small, but agreeable for the excellent fun super-boutique style. Location: At edge of Marais neighborhood, a few blocks from the Bastille square; but equally close to the trendy Oberkampf neighborhood of the 11th arrondissement, which is the new trendy bohemian area, more than the now over-famous Marais. Staff: Agreeable. Doorman gave an EXCELLENT dinner recomendation 1/2 block away on the corner of another small street. An old pharmacy, or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep makes the Paris visit better!”
Reviews.Author: Mohs100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our anniversary. Best beds we ever had in Paris. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and cool. Small boutique hotel. Good location, central but quiet, charming and safe. We loved the area, both Marais and St. Martin. A lot of nice restaurants and shops and galleries!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, relaxing, designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayWooHoo
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a wonderful stay. My partner and I were upgraded to a suite on arrival, which had a bedroom, a reception area with HUGE bath in and separate WC, so we were really spoiled for space, even without accounting for the fact that Paris hotels tend to be titchy rooms. The room was immaculate - very white... King size comfy bed, soft, dense pillows, a night cove thingy that is supposed to be the latest technology in sending you to sleep (plays you seaside noises and works). Gorgeous Korres toiletries. Spent more time in the hotel room than have ever spent on a Paris trip before - including afternoon naps. That's how nice this hotel was. Service was very friendly in the main. You don't get all night bar service and the breakfast is pricey - but then breakfasts in good hotels do tend to be a bit pricey anyway. I would stick to using the local boulangeries for croissants in the morning... Locationwise - it's not in the Marais. But it's not far. It's a good walking distance from the Central-East sites of Paris, and really near Rue Oberkampf which has lots of cool bars and music going on there. The local resto, La Pharmacie also serves decent food and has a good wine list. Would definitely definitely stay again, would book a Superior Room and keep fingers crossed for another upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chris_holdsworth2
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel to stay in! Hotel Gabriel may be a bit on the expensive side but but is so worth it for its central location, beautifully compact rooms, splendidly comfortable beds and great showers, not to mention the quiteness for sleeping in the midst of busy Paris. Perfect location for arrival from euro star at Gare du Nord, we were in our rooms within 20 minutes. The service was great, we all felt really looked after and taken care of - all requests met with politeness, friendliness and a genuine wish to help - from the guys on front desk, to the chamber maids. Loved the fact that breakfast was served until 11!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel in great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: borg321
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend together with my wife and friends at Hotel Gabriel. The design is very cool. A lot of small details that really makes a difference. One of those things was the really nice bath tub that we had in our room. The location is perfect in the up and coming cool neighborhood NoMa. The staff at Hotel Marais was also very helpful. The front desk staff helped us out whenever needed and even went the extra mile of checking websites for any traffic congestions as we were going to the airport. Very much appreciated as we probably saved an hour by getting some advice on the best transportation. Definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Transcendent beds”
Reviews.Author: jenglishlueck
Reviews.Content: I was staying one week on a academic trip, and my husband and I wanted a centrally located, affordable hotel. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were compact but lovely, and the bed easily the best in my diverse travels. The staff are friendly and the rooms impeccable. It is an easy walk to stores, cafes, and especially, the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A FINE HOTEL WITH GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: fortmeyers
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't be more friendly, helpful, and gracious. They went out of their way to make sure that everything was as it should be for our visit. The room was attractively decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is situated on a quiet street and we were never disturbed by noise of any kind. It was a pleasure to stay there,

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. A little different.”
Reviews.Author: Son123123
Reviews.Content: Well located, nice, interesting rooms and helpful staff. Bit on the expensive side for what it is, but worth trying out if you are into alternative therapies etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Froggylondon2
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem in Paris. Quiet area but fairly central. The staff is friendly and helfpul, the breakfasts are special and the rooms are very quiky (in a positive way). We have now stayed there twice (once for business and once for leisure) and will look at staying again the near future. If you are looking for a "boutique" hotel with great staff, it is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pgsanjay
Reviews.Content: Wife loved her short stay here. She was very impressed with the decor and comfort. She also mentioned good service and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Du bluff. Uniquement du bluff.”
Reviews.Author: MLBXL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located but: - I arrive at 11am the room was not ready. The desk "made its possible" to give me another room.. Why telling it to the client.. 2minutes later, i got my room. Anyway - No air conditionning! It was a full sunny day, very hot in the room. No air conditionning because the hotel is still in "winter mode".. - No internet connection during 12 hours! They had to fix the router but no technical agent during the evening. I had to go out of the hotel to end my skype meeting. Thank you! - However the soap was empty, the housekeeping didn't change it. - don't take a big suitcase: you have to choose in the elevator: you or it. Service is really bad.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil and quirky”
Reviews.Author: funkyuncle48
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. Very comfortable room and bed, if a little small. The area is a little out of the centre and has not much to recommend it but within a short walk of the Metro at Republique, Temple and Oberkampf.The Marais is fifteen minutes or so walk .Staff were courteous and attentive

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, trying to be trendy”
Reviews.Author: Macrow11
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt like it was trying to be trendy but it did not quite work for me. However, we had a pleasant stay. Room was quite small for a double, though we did not need much room. The decor is modern and relaxing but starting to wear and tear a bit. The best thing is the bed, which is very comfortable. The bathroom has a sliding door which is very thin, so you can hear everything going on in there! At the hotel walk 10 min to the right and there is a small supermarket for basiscs like water and snacks and further along a few more minutes there is a patisserie where you can sit in for coffee and pastries for breakfast or a break. Location is good, less than 10 min to Republique Metro station (same line as Chatelet Les Halles for the Paris De Gaulle airport train). There are many restaurants and bars in the local area, which appears to be an up and coming area slightly away from the busy and tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “amazing bedrooms, spotless, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gezspencer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for birthday treat and were amazed at the room quality, well worth paying the extra for the 'glowing room' experience with massive bed and also balcony, Probably the best bathroom and room combo ive stayed in round the world. Location is brilliant with a 5 min walk to Republic Metro station, so only 15 mins from Notre Dame etc. Staff really helpful and friendly. Didnt have the breakfast on advice of previous trip advisor quotes but as anywhere in Paris only 2 mins from a cafe in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as a 5 star room at a 3 star price especially if in conjunction with Eurostar ticket. Gez

Reviews.Title: “A really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTowcester
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from those offered as part of a Eurostar package; we made the right choice. From the moment we arrived until we picked our luggae up at the end of our trip we found it comfortable, friendly and welcoming. On the downside, the room was a little on the small side but as we were there to explore Paris we were only in the room to sleep (and, on one morning that I ventured out to the Boulangerie, had breakfast. Lots of gadgets to play with in the room as well: TV, Ipod dock, Night Cove) When we go next time we'll definitely look to book here again. (We means a 55yr old Dad and 11 year old Son - the hotel suited both of us)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: deano8888
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a pleasure to stay in, from the moment we first arived until we left the following day. As we checked in, the lady asked us what we had planned to do for the weekend and then gave us a map and circled the places and explained how to get there, as well as suggesting other places to visit and places to go for dinner. This was very nice and welcoming, and the rest of the hotel staff were this friendly too when we spoke to them. The Hotel's interior is very modern, just like you see in he pictures, and it feels classy and comfortable. The bed is extremely comfortable, easily the best hotel I've ever slept in. The added touches in the rooms really make the hotel feel special, such as the clever lighting, ipod dock, and the hotels natural soap and shampoo products. There is also free wifi in the rooms which is good. The Hotel also has massage treatments etc but these weren't pushed on you, so you're not made to feel like you have to use them. The Hotels location is great, being 5 minute walk from Republique which is only 4 metro stops from Gar du Nord (where the Eurostar goes to), and from Republique you can travel all over paris easily. There are lots of restaurants and bars around the hotel but we went down to St Michel for a meal and a few drinks in the evening - there are some really nice restaurants and bars in this area. All in all, an excellant stay and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: andream39
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris to celebrate my 29th birthday and my sister and I stayed at the Hotel Gabriel Paris Marais and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were only there for one night and because of the jam-packed two days we had, we only spent a few hours in the hotel, but they were well worth the money. The hotel is just off the Av. de la Republique, just a short walk from Republique metro station so with good links to transport. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by very friendly concierge - they even ordered a taxi for us to take us to our restaurant for dinner. The room was small, but strangely, the bathroom was really large - it even had a bath in it. Even so, it was really lovely and welcoming - very clean and tidy. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and just wished I had a little longer in the hotel. If I'm ever back in Paris, and let's face it, I will be - this is my second trip in six months, then I'll be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Yes_Si_Ya
Reviews.Content: I really like this very small and charming design hotel in Marais. White is everywear, the atmosphere is absolutely relaxing and comfortable and the bed is great! I recommend it for work and leisure holidays.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Epicurian10128
Reviews.Content: Coming from NYC, you have very low expectations when you are staying in a major city for less than $300/night! To make a long story short: The location is great, the hotel is incredibly clean, the rooms are very comfortable, the bed is divine, the ambiance is Zen and the staff is over the top! Best Hotel in Paris Ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but overpriced (that's what you pay for design)”
Reviews.Author: Woody-XL
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what to think about this hotel. On the one hand Hotel Gabriel offers the best hotel bed I ever slept in, in a very clean room, in a hotel that was refurbished by an Australian (if I remember correctly) designer, and serving a very good breakfast (bio-organic) quality-wise. But still I feel a bit ripped off, paying 640 euros for three nights plus breakfast for two. Maybe the overpriced part is due to the money that was paid to the interior designer. So, although having slept like a rose, and having had a good breakfast, we also noticed some downside details: - Room: very small, sometimes there was a subtle 'sewer'-smell hanging around (getting better after putting a towel on the shower draining), there was no place to hang our towels, everything got wet when taking a shower (shower curtain, maybe?). - Breakfast: great quality, but not much diversity (only one type of cheese, no charcuterie), very small tables. - Service: our iPod-docking station didn't work. We had to ask several times before it was replaced. Conclusion: the quality of this hotel is good, but it also feels a bit pretentious (maybe because of the designer stuff?), and when paying almost 200 euros for a night, it doesn't entirely live up to it's expectations. If the room would be around 140 euros a night we would consider coming back, but for now we thinks it's too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfy and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: travelingaries
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December on a 4 day trip to Paris. I picked the hotel mainly from reviews on Trip Advisor. I got a good deal from the Eurostar website and booked there. I got a round trip Eurostar ticket from London to Paris and a 4 night stay here for about 455 pounds. The staff was lovely and were happy to help me whenever needed. Spoke English very well and were very patient with me when I spent 10 mins trying to pull my door open. (you have to push it by the way...). The room was so clean! I was scared to put my stuff down and spoil all the white! Reading previous reviews I was expecting a comfy bed and was not disappointed. iPod docking was very convenient so I could use my plug adapter for more important things then charging my iPod. The maid pointed my toilet paper! I thought that was exciting. No hotels Ive been to in Canada, US, or China do that. Down sides? Its a bit hard to find if you dont know where you're going but once you've found it you've got it. When you have a shower (at least in my room) there's only a partition for half of it so there was always water on the floor I had to wipe up. So dont dance in the shower if you dont want to mop the floor. All in all I would subordinately go back! I love trip advisor! They've helped a lot in my travels and thank you to every who recommended this hotel. I have to say it added a lot to the amazing time I spent in Paris! Very clean, quiet for the most part, lighting was cool, location is really good. I didn't realize how small Paris is and how easy it is to get around! Will be back one summer to go to the TOP of the Eiffel Tower this time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, ultra modern and ultra clean”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October during a three night stay to Paris. The hotel is very nice indeed with all mod cons and appears very new. The standard room we opted for was quite small but we knew what we were getting from the hotel's excellent website. The place is quite small so during quieter nights the receptionist doubles as barman which is fine as all of the staff are very friendly. Personally I thought it was expensive at Â£180 per night, but then this is Paris and you always pay twice the price here for something you would get in other cities around Europe. Would definitely stay here again. By the way, it has free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Sam_1884
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for the first time and stayed here. It was all booked on the euro star website for a very reasonable price considering the hotel! It was lovely, small but thatâ€™s Paris, clean and very cosy and relaxing. We again had a smaller room but this was fine, bed was comfy. I would defiantly recommend this hotel. Staff were helpful when asked but didn't bother you if you were fine. Recommended a fabulous restaurant a 5 min walk away for proper Parisian food and it was amazing as it is in the Michelin guide book another defiant recommended meal if you can splash out for a special meal (was 100 euro with wine, 35 set menu each with a cheese platter to die for). Otherwise Republic has a lot of restaurants which are easier and quieter than some of the tourist attractions areas.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, very comfortable, excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Guys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights recently and were delighted with Hotel Gabriel. Being our first time to Paris, we were very grateful for the guidance and recommendations given by the friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble, they really did bend over backwards to make our stay special. Thank you! Our room was gorgeous, cute - not the largest room we've stayed in, however very comfortable and clever design to use the available space economically. It was clean, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. As mentioned elsewhere, the bes is a DREAM - so hard to get out of it!. And there were some lovely touches as well - an iPod docking station, complimentary bottle of water and nuts, a nifty fold-out bar-fridge (very cool!), beautiful bathroom amenities, plush linen and very funky lighting. Breakfast was fresh, healthy and concise, just they way it should be in a boutique hotel, and not as extensive as larger hotels. Having said that, we filled up every morning on some delicious items (while in France, it's hard to go past the croissants!), and there was an endless supply of tea and warm, friendly service - a great start to the day! I would say that the location is almost perfect - close to Republique Metro (which has multiple lines), a stones throw from Canal Saint Marting (highly recommend La Verre Vole for lunch), and a great distance for walking down through Marais (great shops, cafes, just beautiful!) towards the River and all that is on offer along the banks of the Seine. Oh and the street market around the corner is well worth a visit. All in all a fantastic hotel - it's got the right vibe and attitude, so comfortable that it feels like home, and the service is just how it should be - friendly and unassuming, helpul and personal. These great positive features of this hotel far out-shadow the cosy-sized rooms and the fact that there is nowhere to hang your towel.

Reviews.Title: “A great night's sleep in a super stylish hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Freeds01
Reviews.Content: We were staying in a deluxe double room. The bed was very comfortable (we slept very well!), and the shower room was luxurious! The shower was fantastic, although on the negative side there was nowhere to hang your towel! The room was small, but it was cosy, stylish and welcoming. We didn't have the sound and lighting system that other people are talking about, I assume you need an upgraded room to get those features. But we did have an ipod docking station, which we used with our own ipod (I'm told they supply ipods if you don't have). Our minibar fridge wasn't working. This only bothered me as I had medicine that needed to be refridgerated. The hotel staff were very gracious about it, and put it in the main fridge in the bar, which was fine! Overall we really liked this hotel. The staff were great, and we slept like babies!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a deep sleep”
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of days at this hotel and stayed in a room that has some sort of sleep-inducing lighting and sound apparatus that really worked. I have to mention that it was just the two of us and our very energetic 1-year old stayed with her grandma, which allowed us to engage in serious somnotherapy. In other words, we slept like rocks. The room wasn't big and the location is not in the heart of the Marais, but a bit to the side, but it is very well located anyway. I know it sounds strange when someone says that he went to Paris and slept throughout, but we needed it. And we got it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab! Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grumunkin
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel with a Eurostar package from London to Paris, for our 10th wedding anniversary treat - we were not at all disappointed. The room was very clean and very well presented. The ultra-modern style of the room is not usually something that I would appreciate, but it worked really well with the Hotel Gabriel. The soft and clever lighting was very restful, and I can't say enough about the bed - heaven! The room was extremely quiet, so much so that we overslept on our first morning as there was nothing to disturb us. The hotel is located in a quiet street, very close to both Oberkampf and Republique metro stations. Staff were very helpful and friendly - all in all a very pleasant stay. Would recommend to anyone, and would definitely stay there again if the opportunity arose. One downside however - the breakfast was very expensive, so we didn't partake! Would not let this detract though, as there are plenty of little patiseries and cafes about that you can have a coffee and pastry for a lot less euro.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel...awesome staff"...”
Reviews.Author: eddieyyz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at hotel Gabriel. The hotel is 3 minutes walk to Republique, where you can catch the subway to pretty much anywhere in paris. There are several restaurants, cafes and bakeries near by. In 10 minutes you can walk to Le Marais or in 15 minutes to Latin Quartier. The staff was excellent. All spoke english very well and were always willing to help. They were A++++++++++. Our room was very spacious (for paris it was HUGE), and had a small balcony with a table a chairs. Perfect for having drinks before dinner. Although the breakfast was sufficient, we found that perhaps 2 people running it would make it smoother . And perhaps develop some sort of system, for serving every new guest that comes down. (sometimes there was a bit confusion) This didnt affect my perceptions of the hotel at all... i wouldnt hesitate for a second to go back to The Gabriel or to recommend it to anyone who is visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff and a bed to die for...”
Reviews.Author: Roxy_DeMilo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of September for three nights and they were the best three nights sleep I've ever had! The bed was spacious and comfortable and the room was clean and neatly decorated; simple, modern yet elegant. I didn't want anywhere too pricey, but didn't want to stay in a horrible hotel, as I've often found in Paris is you stay too cheaply, and Hotel Gabriel was perfect as it had the balance right. The staff were lovely, and very helpful, always a good morning and good evening. The only problem was the shower overflowed and the water went out into the bedroom, so we had to shower with the power turned down slightly. It's half an hour to most sites, and the area was nice and peaceful, with lots of places to have breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Gabriel”
Reviews.Author: wombat1
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Gabriel on the 17th September. We were warmly welcomed on arrival. We were struck by the simple design, the clean lines of the room, the good quality linen, the large bathroom and host of toilet amenities. We also liked the area which seems to have many new shops and restaurants since our last visit. The only negative of the hotel was that a previous guest had set the alarm on the mp3 player for a very early hour. It is great to have the mp3 with cool music in the rooms but housekeeping should make a note to clear any pre-sets. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mghai
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds. Well connected metro station (Republique) only a short walk away. Quite a few places to eat nearby. Excellent staff. Smallish rooms (but probably reasonable for Paris). Free wi-fi (though you need to reconnect frequently). I paid approx. 182 euros/night with good cancellation options. When I booked many other hotels were full, so I am going to say this was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, hotel doesn't live up to net photos, cool vibe, far from Marais”
Reviews.Author: Skooter22
Reviews.Content: If you've been traveling lately, there seems to be a movement in hotels calling themselves "boutique" properties offering a different experience than the standard Hilton-Sheraton stay. I've found that in big cities, this can mean two things: either, it's an old flop house hotel renovated to look like somebody's idea of "trendy" or it's just an old building renovated for the same reason. It's not hard to see the traces of the original non-boutique property including crumbling walls, dirty corners, etc. That said, I was disappointed in this hotel. The photos on the net were beautiful, and it's a little pricy (150 euros), as Paris is. It seemed like the best deal around, plus I wanted to be close to the Marais. The neighborhood is fine but it's not the Marais. It was raining when we went there and there are only older hard-wood floors with no carpet nor rugs so the room was cold. The linens and bed were great and the bathroom was fine. Everything in the hotel was very nice, but the whole package was lacking and the room was awkward (think "boutique" again). Also, the breakfast is very expensive (25 euros) but you pay for the selection of organic and "bio" products, which were very delicious. One benefit of it being an older French building, you have typical Parisian rooftop views which can be charming. The staff was amazing, and very happy to help. Surprisingly, this is a pretty highly-rated TripAdvisor property which is why I was willing to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “Trying real hard”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: Small room and bathroom. Not a bad location with good places for dinner and brunch within a block. The design is modern, but it feels forced and a little cheap. But not the worst I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful zen hotel!! One of the best sleeps ever!”
Reviews.Author: Paulacns
Reviews.Content: Wonderful design hotel with a zen attitude that make us fall in love! Very well located, you can explore the Marais by foot and very well connected to 5 metro lines. Very friendly staff, which can help you in deciding where to go. Wonderful organic breakfast! Pricey but we all know that truly organic costs more! Free wi-fi! How cool is that! The best bed ever... I have difficulty in sleeping in hotels but not in this one! And the cherry on top of everything is that some rooms have the system Night Cove - system that mixes sound and light to help you relax at night and to wake up in the morning! In 3 minutes my husband was sleeping... Well... I truly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little gem”
Reviews.Author: jwcardinal11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights after a long business trip. It was my first time in the city and I wanted to find a hotel that wasn't in the midst of tourist-ville. The Gabriel Marais was great, in a quiet neighborhood and just a few blocks from the Republique station. The room was small (not unexpected for European standards) but well designed. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I got two great nights of sleep. The staff was very friendly, though I didn't have terribly much interaction with them. Breakfast, and all the food in general in the hotel, was a bit outrageous in pricing (17 euros for breakfast!). That was my only real pet peeve with the hotel. But if you're looking for great value (for everything but the food), this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: ed_wales
Reviews.Content: Clean, very comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Good location, just a couple of stops away from Gare Du Nord. The rooms had a great ambiance thanks to the lighting.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year as good as the 1st!”
Reviews.Author: bennypaul
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year in a row we have chosen Hotel Gabriel. We loved it the 1st time and decided to stay there again this year. We were a bit hesitant that it might not be as good as the 1st time but we were happy to have the same great experience on this year's trip. The room is incredibly comfortable and clean. Love the modern design and the front desk staff is incredibly friendly and helpful! Also, the bed is AMAZING! The only thing we would have liked to have tried but didn't because of the high cost was the breakfast which was 17 euro per person. It looked great but thought the price was high. We went across the street to the corner market which has an amazing variety of everything. Loved Hotel Gabriel and will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: barabas75
Reviews.Content: Although on first appearances the Hotel Gabriel looks very unassuming, there are very few hotels I have visited which represent such great value. At â‚¬129 per room per night for a double, the rooms are compact but very well designed and the bathrooms are excellent. A better TV service could help but the ipod player more than made up for it - and the bed was almost as good as my bed at home.... Sound proofing also makes for a comfortable night and very nice/friendly staff. Good connections to Gard Du Nord but a good 15 mins walk from Le Marais. Still, a great hotel to come back to in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful bed!”
Reviews.Author: Onalin
Reviews.Content: The best bed I've ever slept in. How much more do you need to know? OK, I could tell you about how I stayed here with my sister not long after the hotel opened in 2009, so we got a great opening deal through the Eurostar website. I could tell you about the view from our sunny terrace on the fifth floor. I could tell you about the funky bathroom filled with Korres products. I could tell you about the ipod dock. I could tell you about the beautiful lobby. I could tell you about the wonderful manager, who noticed that I spoke English to my sister while speaking French to him, so when he addressed my sister he immediately spoke English so that she wouldn't feel embarrassed at not speaking the language. But really, I just want to talk about the bed. The bed that was so comfortable when I got in, that I immediately got out just so I could get in again and feel how nice it was. The bed that was like being supported by angels' wings. Angels made of silk. Or maybe, kind of fat angels who also work out - soft, but completely supportive. The bed that my sister and I shared, because we were too cheap to get a twin room, but that felt like we were sleeping in separate beds because there was simply no disturbance. Honeymooners! Come to Paris in low season so it's cheaper, and stay in this hotel. You will have even less reason to leave your room, and you will be glad for it. Shoppers! Come to this hotel. It's not too far from the Marais and Etienne Marcel, and your Isabel Marant boots and Paula Ka dress would look great in the room, trust me. Hipsters! Come to this hotel. It's close to the Canal St-Martin, so you can join Paris's beautiful youth along its banks, drink red wine, and discuss philosophy, cycle culture, and Isabel Marant boots. Insomniacs! Come to this hotel. The Gabriel Marais Bed of Magic will cure your ills!

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: btufan
Reviews.Content: If you would like to experience Paris away from the crowds of Champs Elysee this is the perfect place. It is a hidden gem. As a member of the designhotels, the rooms are all individually decorated and designed. Each room has enough space - and you know what I mean if you know other hotels in Paris - and simple luxury that will make your stay very pleasant. Make sure that you receive tips from the reception for boutiques if you are int o shopping or restaurants if you are travelling for gastronomy! The hotel is also nearby the "Republique" underground station that makes it ony a few stations away from the center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding comfort & staff”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveRenee
Reviews.Content: Reading the TA reviews before we went we were skeptical about all the enthusiasm about the beds. I have a bad back and am pretty picky about mattresses, and how great could a bed be, anyway? Now we know. The bed was *beyond* comfortable: we even tried to get the brand name of mattress and sheets so that we could buy them for our home (not available, unfortunately). Beyond the beds: the staff, to a person, were warm, friendly, helpful, and efficient. Good location: right near Republique with its many convenient metro & bus lines, yet the hotel is on a quiet street and very well sound-proofed. Rooms are small but cleverly designed with lots of storage, and the design motif with glowing walls is a fun touch. The bathroom shower was the one design flaw as it soaked the floor no matter where you pointed the head. But overall this hotel offers outstanding comfort at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goco
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently over bank holiday weekend. Great hotel. Room was compact but perfectly formed. Very clean and good bed. The bathroom had great toiletries and a lovely walk in shower. The location was very convenient for the metro and particularly for eurostar. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful. Overall, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely people!”
Reviews.Author: KaguraCato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in December for a few nights and was hugely impressed by both the hotel and the friendly staff - nothing that was too much trouble for them. If you can afford it, definitely recommend upgrading to a bigger room with the great bath!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel - and bed - in Paris?”
Reviews.Author: VnBadventures
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary, and the hotel is absolutely first class. Situated down a quiet side street near Place de la Republique, with a couple of metro stops (Republique and Oberkampf) very close by, the hotel is in a great location, with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The staff were friendly and very helpful at all times, and the room, although quite compact, was superb. Our bed was incredibly comfy and the ensuite bathroom was immaculate, with a brilliant walk in shower. My girlfriend was highly impressed with the Korres toiletries provided, as well as the supplied hairdryer in the bathroom (we forgot our travel adapter). There is a small restaurant offering breakfast for 17 euros but we chose to eat out instead. Downsides? Absolutely none. We booked through Eurostar and the price was very reasonable for such a nice (and highly rated) hotel. To summarise, the hotel Gabriel Paris Marais is a bit of a gem. Great location, great staff and a very trendy, modern decor throughout, it's a brilliant and very luxurious place to stay while exploring Paris. Highly recommended, we'd return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: coljanford
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location near to Place de la Republique and metro within 500metres. Nice restaurants/cafes/bars near to hotel. Very contemporary styling and adequately sized rooms for Paris. They have to have the best beds in Paris. One of our party is a chronic insomniac but we had to wake him for breakfast after the second night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Boihan
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend this beautiful hotel. Have spent a wonderful weekend in Paris and were super excited, that we specifically chose this hotel. The hotel is small and cozy and in a beautiful contemporary style. The rooms are super wonderful and completely refurbished in modern style and very relaxing. Large comfortable beds with real duvets and a nice bathroom. Everything very clean and new. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located on the outskirts of the charming Marais area and still in the middle of the town. We walked around to all major attractions. We will sure get back to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel but it has its quirks”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a combined Eurostar/hotel package and chose it for its location as I hadn't stayed in the La Republique area before (it's nowhere near Le Marais). It's very discreet, event to the extent that we walked past it twice before realising where it was. It is a Detox hotel and our room, although small, was well furnished and very, very cosy. The bathroom was like a large cubicle in the room but it was also nicely done. We had a large flat screen TV embedded in the wall but either it, or more likely the remote control, was not working. Because the TV was behind a sheet of glass in the wall, we couldn't operate it manually. I reported the fault to the reception in the morning, but when we got back in the evening, found that they had done nothing about it at all. So, we had no TV for the two nights of our stay. Our complimentary water was also missing. I didn't even know we should have had one until I read it in the booklet on the second day. So we never got that! Breakfast was taken in the breakfast area on the ground floor. I knew it was a rather pricey â‚¬17 each but thought we would try it. Oh dear! There were a few bread rolls, some cereals, cheese and some hard boiled eggs. No cold meats but that's usual in Paris. There was no orange or other juice on display - you had to ask for it as it was kept behind the counter and accessible only to the staff. Worth â‚¬17? No way! We didn't bother on the second day. Finally, at the checkout, the hotel presented me with a bill for two nights' accommodation. They didn't seem to realise that I had already paid in advance. Soon sorted but what was most galling was the amount they were asking for was considerably less than what I'd paid through Eurostar. So, it seems that it often pays to book direct with the hotel rather than assuming you will get a discount when booking as part of a package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, friendly, fun hotel with an informative staff. I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron F
Reviews.Content: I had been away from home for work in Africa for over two months and I decided to spend a few weeks traveling through Europe on my way home. I found Hotel Gabriel online while I was traveling through Spain. It was not an easy decision because Paris had so many hotels that look great online. I had never been to Paris and didn't know the neighborhoods but I was so lucky. The Marais Area (spreads across parts of the 3rd and 4th arrondissements) is amazing. I didn't use mass transit once during my stay, I walked everywhere. It was December, cold and snowing most of the time but everything was still comfortably within walking distance. The furthest landmark from the hotel must have been Arc de Triomphe which I visited on my way to the Palais de Chaillot and then on to Tour Effiel. I saw every notable landmark in Paris on foot from Hotel Gabriel. At night after dinner it was a very short walk to the best nightlife in the city, Rue Oberkampf. My room was amazing, clean and modern. The hotel has a "Detox" theme that has as much to do with your mind as your body (and luckily nothing to do with alcohol, because I like to drink in the evenings). I really enjoy the peaceful feeling that this theme imposed on me by my choice. The hotel staff was more than friendly, they went out of there way to be accommodating. Any hour of the day or night a staff member was present and able to speak to me in English (I know I should work more on my French).Any question I had was meet with a thought out and helpful answer. I am very pleased with Hotel Gabriel and its staff. Only thing that I didn't like is that the complementary bottle of water was not replenished each morning, I only got one for my entire stay. Had to drink tap water, what a shame. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep and good service - 10mn walk from Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: Bob_California94404
Reviews.Content: My latest stay in Paris was at another hotel in the 11th district (Hotel BLC) - and this allowed me to discover in the room an amazing light & sound hotel system for wellness, sleep and wake-up. Searching about it on the net I saw that another hotel nearby in the 11th also offered the service in some of its rooms. That's how I selected Hotel Gabriel and I have to say that I was really not disappointed by my choice. The staff was really efficient and welcoming and the room that I got was cozy and clean. I was delighted to be able to use again the NightCove sleep system which, combined with the high-quality mattress, gave me two nights of great sleep - waking up really refreshed in the morning. The two points that I was surprised about: - the hotel name made me believe it is in or very near Le Marais. Even though the area where the hotel is located is nice, it is actually a 10-mn walk away from Le Marais and closer to Republique. It's convenient for transport but it is not Le Marais. - I found the hotel breakfast a bit overpriced and preferred to go to the nearby coffee shop which was actually excellent.
