Besides these two points I was delighted by my two-night stay there and really felt I slept well thanks to the room, mattress and the sleep system.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Seeing the City”
Reviews.Author: carlton858
Reviews.Content: This trendy, comfortable hotel is located a few blocks from the Place de Republique and the nearest metro stop is Oberkamph. Hotel Gabriel is an immaculate, well-designed property with the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a long time. There are a number of excellent restaurants - whether you want breakfast, lunch or dinner - within east walking distance of the hotel. If you are looking for a Holiday Inn Express style room, then this hotel is not for you. If you want a hotel with friendly, knowledgeable staff with excellent attention to the details, then stay here. My only quibble is the slightly misleading name - this hotel is decidedly outside the Marais. That said, a taxi a ride from the nightlife in the Marias was only 8 euro. We would definitely stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “the front desk left a bitter taste”
Reviews.Author: mountfranklin
Reviews.Content: i contacted the hotel two months in advance asking for special rates - the hotel manager (Julien) gave me rates higher than those advertised on the hotel's website. Despite his non- co operation I booked a three night's stay via the hotel's website and subsequently contacted the hotel to organise a suttle transfer for me. Upon my arrival at CDG I telephoned the hotel requesting the shuttle number so that I could organise my pick-up. The night manager was very difficult to understand - and could not help me with the shuttle. The hotel room was pleasant but I would not go far as to say that it is a 4 star hotel. No way near it. I was considering extending my stay so I asked the front desk for the price of an additional night's stay (Tuesday night) - he gave me an amount of 180 Euro but suggested that I return and ask the desk manager Julien for a "better price". After a few hours I returned asking the desk manager, just as the desk manager "Julien" was about to give me a price (he was saying one-thirrrrr), the gentleman I originally had the discussion with told him in french the figure (not knowing that I understand francais) that he gave me earlier that day thus altering the manager's price (he changed from 130Euro to 180Euro). This put me right off and I checked out, moved to the Hotel Cecilia in Avenue MacMahon, a true 4 star hotel. I will not return to hotel gabriel again nor would I recommend it to my friends or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Too much hype, not enough substance - a good 2 star.”
Reviews.Author: Mad-In-Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: A clean, well run, basic hotel, with modern decor, situated a good 30 minute walk from the Marais. The addition of the Marais in the title is obviously designed to trick the unsuspecting traveller into thinking that the hotel is situated there, but trust me, it isn't! It is not a 'Detox' hotel - it does offer in room massage etc from an external operator, but offers nothing else than an 'organic' continental breakfast at Â£17 a pop! Another marketing masterstroke! It is a clean hotel , but ultimately it is a recently refurbished old terraced hotel with a coat of paint and some plastic room fittings and new laminate floors. I wouldn't like to see it in 5 years time, when the finishes aren't as good. The staff are pleasant enough, but watched my wife and me struggle to the 2nd floor with our suitcases without lifting a finger to help, then hung around hoping for a tip! At Â£140 a night without breakfast, in November, I think it's a little expensive. The Crowne Plaza around the corner is far superior (I've stayed there twice before), and about the same price if booked in advance. The buffet breakfasts there are legendary! Ultimately, I was looking forward to a great experience at the Hotel Gabriel Marais, but had an average time, in an average hotel, next to the Place De La Republique.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gabriel Paris Marais is a fantastic gem”
Reviews.Author: PhotoAdventurer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVE this hotel. We are world travelers, have stayed in many 4 star hotels and I can't say enough about the excellence of the Hotel Gabriel in the Marais. It is beautifully designed... with unbelievable attention to details, from the lobby on up. Paris is notorious for its hit and miss in hotel ratings (some 3 or 4 stars, I would consider 2), and this one is a true 4-star. The service was great, the rooms and bathroom brand new, with a very progressive, hip, design that beats Phillipe Starck hotels hands down. I was blown away by the way the resin walls light up. We liked the relaxing atmosphere, the zen spa, and the cleansing tea bar (I took part in that - my husband stuck to the vodka part of the bar!) For a regular double room - the bed was comfortable; sheets luxe; and the room size a little above average in terms of size and way above in comfort. The staff was knowledgeable, spoke English as a second language and most importantly were polite about it which is not everywhere in Paris. The hotel is located in an up and coming area on the edge of the Marais, like Soho in NYC at its start. It's a very lively, active, fun neighborhood. We found some charming restaurants in the area and traveled in minutes to all the tourist spots. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Horli34
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room in a fantastic hotel. The staff were cheery and very helpful. The rooms were big enough and comfortable and clean. The bed was a 'dream', and ameneties very good quality. The bathroom was excellent. I was a lone traveller on business but would definitely go back with my partner for a romantic stay. Can't recommend this highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed and compact boutique hotel room”
Reviews.Author: TokyoV
Reviews.Content: Pros -Pleasant and friendly Front Desk staff -Beautifully designed hotel rooms with unique lighting -The TV had a good selection of cable channels -Heavenly comfortable mattress -Incredibly silent room temperature control unit (I wish all hotels had these!) -Free wireless internet access throughout the hotel -Location convenient to Republique's metro station and shops. The hotel itself is located on a quiet side street off the main boulevard. Cons -17.00 euros for a buffet-style breakfast is overpriced. I recommend the "Chez Jean" grocery and deli store nearby for breakfast! -Even though the room was compact and well-designed, it must have been the smallest room I have ever stayed in! 16 sqm can be stifling if you are staying for 3 nights and over.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and stylish boutique hotel nestled between Marais and Canal St. Martin ...”
Reviews.Author: eegieweegie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gabriel in September 2009. I would stay there again. Pros: - Very clean - Extremely comfortable bed (best I've experienced in Paris) - Newly renovated/stylish - Flat panel TV/iPod dock/clock radio - Excellent shower (strong water pressure) - Good soundproofing between rooms (generally quiet except for people talking in the hallway occasionally) - Non-smoking - Convenient location (very close to two metros; walking distance to Marais and Canal St. Martin and central Paris) - Close to restaurants, patisseries, bars Cons: - Service was a little uneven -- the woman at reception during the day could have been more responsive/efficient. The evening reception staff was superb (good restaurant recommendations, charming/friendly, etc.) - Single room was much smaller than the room presented on the website -- There was barely room for my luggage, and the shower door did was small, so the shower flooded into the bedroom a little bit unless I put towels on the floor). I basically was only in the room to sleep, so the size of the room was not a major issue -- and the room was designed to maximize space -- lots of clever cupboards, flat panel TV, etc. - Free wifi didn't always work. Generally it was very pleasant and the location was excellent (near lots of good restaurants, shopping, transport, etc.). I would not pay full rate for the single rooms, but I got a good deal online and it was good value for money. The only reason I gave it a 4 is because the room was smaller than expected and someone was actually smoking in the room next to me in the middle of the night (the non-smoking policy was not enforced -- but the hotel staff seemed concerned when I mentioned it in the a.m.). Perfect hotel for a weekend trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel just a little bit more attn to detail.”
Reviews.Author: londonbabe73
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely small hotel just approx 5 mins walk from the republic metro stop so not in the middle of town but a couple of stops from the eurostar terminal. The hotel is very design savvy and the room was an average size with handy storage but a little too much design and not a lot of practical. Pro's close to metro / eurostar decent sized rooms ( for paris) very comfortable bed gorgeous rainfall shower ( no bath) michael kor's toiletries quite street free wif ( when it worked signal hoovered between poor and very poor so i gave up) i pod dock (i home ) in the rooms plus you can borrow one of their preloaded i pods if you forget yours cons management didnt have a clue , asked for a late check out the night before one said yes then called back to confirm and they changed their minds without telling us !!!!! tried to get an iron and you would have thought i was asking for the holy grail had to ask 4 times until i threw a wobbly as had to iron my dress for a posh dinner that night. Mini bar advertised free water and some snacks we never received any in 4 days organic breakfast was 15 euro each so we skipped it 2 coffee places across the road and loads at the placa de republic 5 mins up the road. spent 2 nights with the service door on our floor grating and squeak ing complained to reception on the first morning when it work us up as the maids were up and down next day still no change my other half went and put shampoo on the joints and it was fine lol. stingy with toiletries ( as most hotels these days ) 1tiny bottle of shower gel between 2 ?? i was having 2 showers sometimes 3 a day and it was 90 degree's so had to keep ringing down for more. only bbc world service and bbc news on the tv Other than that a nice hotel for couples having a romantic break and wanting somewhere a bit more special got a good rate of Â£85 pn on expedia wouldn't pay over Â£100 pn but at this rate it was fine wouldn't really recommend for children. The hotel did have a bar but NEVER saw anyone in it in fact only saw 4 other guests in 5 days so presuming either everyone left by 8am or it was half empty.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel, delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: honorede
Reviews.Content: For a couple of nights in Paris you can do no better than treat yourself to the most comfortable bed and cosy rooms to be found anywhere. A complete haven of peace and self-indulgence. Couldn't be better located the staff are great. You might even get to glimpse the odd celebrity in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BED EVER ...”
Reviews.Author: Thepuppylovers
Reviews.Content: Imagine you just found your puppy love on Facebook after 20 years. This is the good news. But one lives in the south of France the other in London. We met In Paris... and chose our friend new Hotel, The Gabriel. We really loved it and spent 2 days in bed, just going out for dinner at the near by "Hotel de Nord", Canal St martin, "Omar" or "Coffee parisien" for brunch. The room was stunning with its Art deco modern way lights, the original paintings, the perfect bathroom and above all, the incredibly comfortable white bed.The organic breakfast is delicious. When you close the door and leave, you already know you will come back...

Reviews.Title: “clean,chic and smart”
Reviews.Author: beaucaireboogie
Reviews.Content: I came to the hotel gabriel through the advice of an american friend who had appreciated its avant garde design hi-tech rooms and central position.It is a lovely art-deco building completely renovated.,our room was on the 4th of 6 floors with a view over the parisian rooftops,all white with a large very comfortable bed,very interesting artwork and all modern bathroom wjth high pressure shower.I have been coming to Paris for many years and contrary to an earlier posting on this site I found the rooms to be quite large for parisian standards and for me Republic is in the heart of Paris with very easy access to all one wants to see. My girl friend loved the decoration and above all the silence of the room.The staff wery very friendly and helpful, spoke english,and knew where all the museums are.The breakfast is excellent, all organic and you can eat as much as you like.I recommend the kusmi tea as a great way to start the day.Otherwise the hotel is a 3 minute walk to the closest metro (republic)and there are many cafes and good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “a work of art in hotel form”
Reviews.Author: jaymancapetown
Reviews.Content: the hotel gabriel marais is a feast of comfort and refinement. The design a stunning fusion of modern innovation and otherworldly zen bliss. I really felt I'd discovered a work of art in hotel form. The staff are adorable and give the place a real family feel. They were spot on with their recommendations for restaurants in the diverse and buzzy surrounding area. But it's difficult to imagine a quieter more cocoon-like room in the centre of paris. Definitely the most comfortable hotel bed I can remember. In fact the only reason to drag oneself out of it was the delicious breakfast. Oh, and Paris of course...

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, comfortable, quiet. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: kanga888
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on these reviews. stayed on fourth floor. Was well equipped, clean, quiet and extremely comfortable. Would recommend and would return. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, 'concept' hotel but as with all concepts - not at all pratical”
Reviews.Author: Eifel50
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as the rooms were billed as 'larger than average'. Our room - a twin on the second floor was not. If one of us was sitting at the end of the bed, the other person could not get past. It was a beautiful looking room, the concept was right - however, it was not meant to be used - and in fact no-one had used It or checked it out from a pratical point of view. It was designed for a single person, who was no more than 4 ft tall, with no luggage and an aversion to hot water. - (we could not get hot water for 3 days). The bathroom was also beautiful (it might have been a wet room??) everytime we had a shower from the 'concept' shower, it went all over the floor. There was no hot water for a shower. We advised reception on the first morning, but assured everything was fine. We could not open the window in the bathroom - it got stuck on the bracket which held the window blinds. There was no storage in the bathroom apart from two squares attached to the sink. Consequently after you had removed the carefully balanced 'small' bath towels from the side of the bath and used them, there was no where to hang them afterwards! There was no wastepaper bin in the bedroom, but yes, we did have the smallest waste bin possible in the bathroom. To use the mirror in the bedroom which was incorporated into a pull down cabinet, you had to lie prostrate on the bed - it was useless. The breakfast was expensive at 17 Euros. On the plus side, the room had plenty of plug points, (even if in some cases you could not get access to them), and the hotel is in a great location, nr Republique Metro. It was a pleasure to return home and have a 'hot' shower. By all means go and take a look at the hotel, or have your photograph taken there, but I would not recommend staying there until they sort out the praticalities.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leicstourist
Reviews.Content: Nothing but praise for this hotel. Excellent and welcoming staff. High standard of decoration throughout the building. Well designed, very tasteful rooms, small but everything you could possibly need. Spotless throughout. Very comfortable beds with real pillows - great nights sleep. Location good as plenty of cafes and restaurants in the immediate area. Felt a very safe area, and the La Republique metro has so many lines running through it you can get anywhere in Paris easily. It is on a quiet side street so no disturbance at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel that combine hip design with peaceful comfort!”
Reviews.Author: HotPig
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Hotel Gabriel when visiting friends in Paris. It's a great boutique hotel in Paris chicest neighbourhood. When checking in I actually stumbled into the owner who gave me a tour around the hotel and told me the history of it and how it had just been entirely remodelled. The staff was really helpful and even though the hotel is situated in a neighbourhood crowded with restaurants and nightlife, the rooms where calm and quite and the bed amazingly comfortable! I loved everything from the design details, the lit up walls, the bathroom, the wide assortment of Kusmin teas and the sleeping device that woke me up in the morning with music and soft light :-) Will most definitely come back!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gabriel Paris Marais
HotelInfo.Address: 25 rue du Grand Prieure, 75011 Paris, France
